went here on the opening weekend, and everything seemed to be <mark>G</mark> off without a hitch! reservations are required; my <mark>G</mark> made ours months in advance due to the <mark>G</mark> opening. while waiting for the table, we took pictures at the photo booth which was cool. when the hostess sat us, she <mark>G</mark> us a mini tour of the prep areas where they make the hand made pasta, <mark>Marinated Olives</mark>, pizza, focaccia, etc. everything is fresh and looks amazing!

we had a seat near the opened window, overlooking the strip and the bella<mark>G</mark> fountain. our server was very personable and knowled<mark>G</mark>, i'd expect nothing less. he brou<mark>G</mark> us probably the best tasting focaccia i've ever had, and we ordered the sausa<mark>G</mark> stuffed dates as an appetizer; also amazing. perfect combination of salty, sweet and spicy. 

for the entr\u00e9e, i ordered the branzino and my <mark>G</mark> had the spring pea and panceta tortellini. the branzino was perfectly cooked, and the citrus sauce and aru<mark>G</mark> salad made it very refreshing. the tortellini was fantastic, and i'm not one that likes peas.

finally, desert came and i wasn't expecting much. we ordered the tiramisu which came in layered shot <mark>G</mark>. my nonna makes <mark>G</mark> tiramisu, so i had hi<mark>G</mark> expectations. there were three flavors: pb&j, chocolate and blackberry lime. all three were delicious, but pb&j was the best! we ordered mochas as well, extremely decadent and <mark>G</mark> with <mark>G</mark>'s si<mark>G</mark> "g" in chocolate. a pretty heavy desert but well worth it. 

overall, just a <mark>G</mark> experience in terms of food and service. <mark>G</mark> even came to our table and talked with us for a little. <mark>G</mark> say, it was pretty unfor<mark>G</mark>, will definitely be <mark>G</mark> back!

this was an excellent restaurant to celebrate our anniversary.  the decor was beautiful, the menu was unique and delicious and the service was first rate. we shared three antipasti - <mark>Marinated Olives</mark>, rolled octopus and bacon wrapped dates.  the spa<mark>G</mark> with shrimp and the scallop risotto were our entrees and for dessert we enjoyed peanut butter and jelly tiramisu and chocolate sorbet that was so rich it could have passed for <mark>G</mark>.  i have not tried to describe the dishes only to say that they were just <mark>G</mark> and you will have to taste them yourself.  and don't expect this italian restaurant to be like any other you may have experienced.

hands down the nicest dining experience i have ever had!  my wife and i went for my 40th birthday dinner. from start to finish was exemplary. upon being seated we were <mark>G</mark> by the mana<mark>G</mark> laurant, and invited to a table which had just come available.  it was a wonderful window table with an amazing view.  we started with two outstanding si<mark>G</mark> cocktails and four appetizers. <mark>Orzo Meatballs</mark>, <mark>Marinated Olives</mark>, a blue cheese plate with pears and honeycomb and a crostini. by the time we were done with the appetizers we had <mark>G</mark> into our bottle of wine which was su<mark>G</mark> to us by darius, the master sommelier. he nailed it.  next was a kale salad and it was fabulous. our last dish was a truffle barley pasta. all dishes were <mark>G</mark> flavorful and deli<mark>G</mark>.  to finish it all off we had a couple of little desserts and coffee.  our server kevin allowed my to enjoy my dishes at my pace. i eat slow and savor my meals. i felt comfortable to enjoy the ambience, my wife, the view, the wine, and the food for all it was worth.  thanks to all at <mark>G</mark>!

<mark>G</mark> <mark>G</mark> <mark>G</mark>. this place is amazing. what a beautiful venue. located in the cromwell on the second floor with views to die this is a <mark>G</mark> place for lunch or dinner. we came for lunch and the natural li<mark>G</mark> from the panoramic windows truly kept the place bri<mark>G</mark>. it was a two hour wait for a table by the window so we sat at the bar. which is perfect because we really are bar people. 

now the only reason im <mark>G</mark> a 4 star review instead of a 5 star is for the service. the bartenders couldnt have been bothered any less then to help us out. we sat at the bar for 10 minutes before we could even be <mark>G</mark>. when we finally were i ordered a ciroc and soda and the <mark>G</mark> didnt even know what ciroc was.. now i would understand if i ordered something completely off the wall but i mean come on... thats pretty standard. andy ordered a coffee and the bartender spatted off a list of different cappuccinos they had its like no dude, just a re<mark>G</mark> coffee lol the other bartender nicole was also kind of a ni<mark>G</mark>. she was <mark>G</mark> away drinks left and ri<mark>G</mark> to the folks sitting next to us so maybe she knew them? 

but when that was over we started ordering a few dishes. we had the pasta fazoli soup which was pretty <mark>G</mark>, not the best but certainly not the worst. we also had the <mark>Marinated Olives</mark>, also not the best. but then we tried the <mark>Chicken Marsala Meatballs</mark> and those were phenom. 5 bite sized meatballs with roasted wiled mushrooms. wow. they seriously melted in your mouth. so <mark>G</mark>! then we had the <mark>Salumi Picante</mark> pizza. this is probably one of the best food items ive ever had in a restaurant. spicy dry sausa<mark>G</mark>, san marzano tomato sauce, mozzarella, and ore<mark>G</mark>. but let me just talk about the crust for a second... that pizza dou<mark>G</mark> could cure cancer. i mean seriously it was amazing. 
for dessert we had the zeppoli. now im a hu<mark>G</mark> fan of this dessert, its always been my <mark>G</mark>-to while at an italian restaurant but this one was made like ive never had before. it wasnt sweet, like ive normally had. and it had lemon zest sprinkled all over. im <mark>G</mark> to have to try it a<mark>G</mark> to see if i really liked it because oddly enou<mark>G</mark> im kind of unsure. 

this was a <mark>G</mark> place and we will def be back, but we will make a reservation for a table next time and hopefully receive better service.

this stop is a <mark>G</mark> on the strip. situated on the second floor of the cromwell hotel across las ve<mark>G</mark> blvd from caesar's palace, the view is excellent. depending on the time of day and your seating location you may even take in a view of the bella<mark>G</mark> fountain show. the service was a bit slow and we spent rou<mark>G</mark> 15 minutes there before anyone came to our table, but our server seemed to have a number of tables so we can certainly understand the delay. we were there for lunch and as this was a special occasion, we brou<mark>G</mark> our own bottle of wine. the corking fee was a bit hi<mark>G</mark> (but not for ve<mark>G</mark> prices) at $35, but it was still a steal considering that almost every wine on the list was an ultra premium wine. once we ordered, our food came out exceptionally fast. we hi<mark>G</mark> recommend the <mark>G's Baked Pasta</mark> of the day, the buratta cheese (buffalo mozzarella), <mark>Baby Sweet Peppers</mark> and <mark>Marinated Olives</mark>. our total dining experience lasted over 1 1/2 hrs. we were so fulfilled by the time we left. in the end, when our check came, we found that the corking fee was not on it. this may have been due to the fact that we bou<mark>G</mark> so many dishes during lunch or maybe our overwhelmed server simply for<mark>G</mark>, but we weren't complaining :) 

i would hi<mark>G</mark> recommend <mark>G</mark>'s for lunch!  all their food is fresh and homemade, which is somewhat rare these days, even on the strip.

we had a <mark>G</mark> meal.  we came here over the last weekend in march.   ori<mark>G</mark> we were not able to make a reservation, but we came early (~6:00 pm) on a friday and the staff was able to accommodate us.  the pasta was especially <mark>G</mark> - we had the pappardelle, spa<mark>G</mark>, and ravioli.  we also ordered the lamb - there were 4 of us and we ate it all family style.   we also had the <mark>Marinated Olives</mark>, <mark>Orzo Meatballs</mark>, and bacon dates as appetizers.  all were quite <mark>G</mark>.   we decided to <mark>G</mark> italian-style and order sparkling mineral water with our meal, which i think added to the experience (especially since we don't drink much wine).   

as the sun set, the restaurant opened the windows which overlooked the las ve<mark>G</mark> strip.   it was a <mark>G</mark> view.  our indoor dining was now al fresco. with the warm ve<mark>G</mark> ni<mark>G</mark>, this additional physical feature of the restaurant made the experience much more enjoyable.  re<mark>G</mark> service, a<mark>G</mark>, it was top notch.  our waiter, cliff, was very personable and attentive.  he made us feel like family.   the only minor down side we saw was when a different waiter accidentally broke a <mark>G</mark> by our table and did not immediately clean up the <mark>G</mark> shards, waiting for one of the other staff to clean it up

<mark>G</mark> at the cromwell hotel on the ve<mark>G</mark> strip is the finest italian restaurant i have eaten at in the united states. i have traveled the world and have to say that this is authentic italian at its best!
the location on a prominent corner of the ve<mark>G</mark> strip is ma<mark>G</mark> and overlooks the dancing waters at the bella<mark>G</mark> hotel across the street. lar<mark>G</mark> windows wrap the entire corner and <mark>G</mark> a panoramic view never before seen in ve<mark>G</mark>.
the interior is beautiful with indirect li<mark>G</mark> that makes everyone look <mark>G</mark> and sets the mood for a wonderful evening. the chairs are comfortable and encoura<mark>G</mark> a leisurely evening.
start with a specialty italian inspired cocktail, not seen on many menus. beautifully presented and delicious! 
for starters, the antipasti selection is amazing. we totally enjoyed the <mark>Marinated Olives</mark>, <mark>Baby Sweet Peppers</mark>,the soppressata (with <mark>G</mark> and pepper)and the parmi<mark>G</mark>-re<mark>G</mark> with wild sa<mark>G</mark> honey was exquisite!
fabulous bread is baked and served in a mini dutch oven alon<mark>G</mark> sea salt and basil aoli and capers and chili flakes and silky soft butter. 
we shared the rack of lamb- mustard crusted and the pappardelle with pork ra<mark>G</mark> (not usually seen) and both were to perfection!
for dessert we had the limoncello souffle with house made buttermilk ice cream and lemon hazelnut cake tower with lemon curd on top .both desserts rank among the most delicious desserts i have eaten in a restaurant.
do not miss trying the lemon ricotta cookies topped with lemon <mark>G</mark>, an absolute must! 
carissa and <mark>G</mark>  are doing a remarkable job making this restaurant a not to miss destination while in ve<mark>G</mark>. personable and professional and friendly, these two know how to run an outstanding italian eatery.
do not miss the opportunity to experience this ma<mark>G</mark> environment, it does not exist many places these days.
i look forward to many future visits.
jeff z.

dropped by this little joint for lunch yesterday.  the restaurant has been open for about six weeks but has only been serving lunch since last wednesday.  the mana<mark>G</mark> told me that reservations are pretty much required for dinner but lunch is easier to drop by and eat.  i'm <mark>G</mark> it's because people are sleeping off the prior ni<mark>G</mark>'s festivities.  

first off, the staff is very friendly and attentive.  the tables by the windows have a <mark>G</mark> view of the strip.  there is a nice loun<mark>G</mark> area between the tables and the bar.  

the lunch menu is smaller than the dinner menu, serving antipasti, salads, pizzas, and sandwiches.  oh yeah, desert too. :-) 

started off with a <mark>G</mark> of red win san<mark>G</mark>.  very tasty but a little on the expensive side.  first to arrive was very <mark>G</mark> bread served with an equally tasty pesto.

i had the <mark>Wood Roasted Mushrooms</mark> for my antipasti.  it was oyster mushrooms with toasted marcona almonds and ricotta salata.  very <mark>G</mark> antipasti.  i really like marcona almonds because they are so buttery but i felt the flavor <mark>G</mark> a little lost in this dish.

next was the carbonara pizza.  basically it was a <mark>G</mark> italian breakfast pizza.  it was topped with two fried e<mark>G</mark> and prosciutto (i think it was <mark>Prosciutto San Daniele</mark>), and black pepper.  the dou<mark>G</mark> was not very thick, the prosciutto was flavorful without being too salty, and the yolk running off the sides added to the flavor.  overall an excellent dish!

i wanted a li<mark>G</mark> desert so i ordered the sorbet and <mark>G</mark>.  my mistake!  it came with a small scoop of each flavor: strawberry sorbet, banana sorbet, chocolate <mark>G</mark> and white chocolate <mark>G</mark>.  the sorbets were li<mark>G</mark> and full of the fruit flavors.  the <mark>G</mark> were also very flavorful and insanely rich!

the presentations for lunch were pretty strai<mark>G</mark> forward.  i'm <mark>G</mark> dinners plates come out a little more artistically.  i <mark>G</mark> i have to come back for dinner and find out.

so make a reservation, come to ve<mark>G</mark>, and enjoy!

we made a reservation about 1 month in advance for our dinner at <mark>G</mark>'s. my husband and i were celebrating our 10 year anniversary and my mother joined us for our meal (her treat which was awesome). our seating time was @5:15, and we arrived a few mins early so we stood and looked at the different pictures and such on the walls before being seated. we were <mark>G</mark> a tour of the stations and explained what each person was doing. we were seated in the corner, kind of like a little private space, it was really nice. the windows were shut and blinds pulled because the sun just pounds that space from about 5:00-7:00. once 7:00 hit, they raised the shades so you could look outside. upon being seated, we were <mark>G</mark> by our server who was very very very knowled<mark>G</mark> about everything. he showed us the i-pad with the drinks and such. also, we had a lady who would fill our waters and <mark>G</mark> new plates and such for courses. she was so kind, we warned her we were extremely thirsty as we had played tennis at the cosmo that day and she sure made her promise of never leaving us with an empty water <mark>G</mark>. the <mark>G</mark> mana<mark>G</mark> also came by to introduce us and to wish us a happy anniversary. 

we choose the following 3 drinks to kind of "share" and "try"........

#1 hannibal: botran reserve rum, maurin quina, fresh lime, blood oran<mark>G</mark> and mint syrup, chianti float. it was served in a <mark>G</mark> <mark>G</mark> <mark>G</mark> with crushed ice. the chianti float was served in a lime turned inside out. 

#2 la strada: campari, homemade lemon sorbeto, berta<mark>G</mark> limoncello, proseco. this was the li<mark>G</mark> of the drinks. very refreshing.

#3 the destroyer (conan the destroyer)
clase azul tequila reposado, fresh tan<mark>G</mark>, oran<mark>G</mark> and basil, basil ice sphere. this was the stron<mark>G</mark> and my husbands favorite. 

we then choose 3 apps to share:

#1 <mark>Wood Roasted Mushrooms</mark> w/ toasted marcona almonds & ricotta salata. very <mark>G</mark>, <mark>G</mark> assortment of different mushrooms.

#2 *rollatini - ricotta stuffed e<mark>G</mark> & pomodoro. very small but very <mark>G</mark>.

#3 calabrese, spicy calabrian chili, the ori<mark>G</mark> pepperoni, pork. when ordered, this was my least favorite but ended up being very very <mark>G</mark>.

#4 (just my husband) pasta e fa<mark>G</mark> w/ creste di <mark>G</mark>, cannellini & parmi<mark>G</mark>-re<mark>G</mark> (soup)

my husband and mother shared the assortment of breads and breadsticks as i cannot eat them because of wheat aller<mark>G</mark>. they were very kind in asking if it was ok if they brou<mark>G</mark> the bread out as i could not have it. 

we then choose 2 pasta courses to share. i am <mark>G</mark> free, so the knowled<mark>G</mark> the server had about it was wonderful. 

#1 *spa<mark>G</mark> (spah-<mark>G</mark>-tee) shrimp, lemon & basil made with their house made <mark>G</mark> free pasta. it was excellent. i always <mark>G</mark> worried ordering <mark>G</mark> free pasta as its usually just an afterthou<mark>G</mark>. the server assured me that <mark>G</mark> would not put something on the menu she was not confident was the best. let me tell you this was the best <mark>G</mark> free pasta i have ever had. i could tell the time and perfection that went into it. that ni<mark>G</mark>, the <mark>G</mark> free pasta was a bucatini. 

#2 risotto (ree-zoht-oh) crab & scallops. the scallops were amazing. i could of eaten a meal just on that. risotto perfectly cooked. 

we then choose 2 mains to share. honestly, if i went a<mark>G</mark>, i would just order more apps and pasta courses and skip mains. don't <mark>G</mark> me wrong, the mains were very <mark>G</mark> but i just really loved the apps and pastas.

#1 branzino, w/ tan<mark>G</mark> vinai<mark>G</mark>. very <mark>G</mark> and very fresh. 

#2 whole roasted chicken for two, cacciatore style. beautiful presentation before actually cutting it up and serving. chicken had a spicy rub and the sauce made from the ve<mark>G</mark> roasted with the chicken were <mark>G</mark>. 


all ni<mark>G</mark> we watched this poor desert <mark>G</mark> push his cart around trying to not to take people out. its a cool idea but really seems like it <mark>G</mark> in the way. his cart was parked by us and they switched the cookies out 3 times during our 2 hours. kind of seems like a waste, i hope they <mark>G</mark> those cookies to the food pantry or something. they presented us with a plate that said happy anniversary written in chocolate and we choose a very <mark>G</mark> strawberry sorbet to share. 

all in all i would say <mark>G</mark>'s was a wonderful experience and one i will never for<mark>G</mark>. it was a very beautiful place and classy yet i never felt out of place. it still had a very casual feel and i love how they encoura<mark>G</mark> you to share with your <mark>G</mark>. it really makes dining fun and allows you try new thin<mark>G</mark>. we all decided this would have to be added to our yearly trip each year.

had a very nice lunch today with my 3 <mark>G</mark>~
    lets start with the host stand~ like most restaurants in lv, the hostess's are all young <mark>G</mark> and wore adorable white eyelet type dresses. we were there upon opening so there where people apparently w/o reservations, however we were seated after them.....it all worked out just thou<mark>G</mark> that was a little off~ the <mark>G</mark> who seated us was polite, conversational and pulled all 4 chairs out for us~ sli<mark>G</mark> awkward however still a nice touch!
   our server sean/shawn was very attentive, conversational, polite, well <mark>G</mark> and definitely knew the menu ~ everything we ordered was quite <mark>G</mark>, can't say delicious.
    the starters we ordered the <mark>Wood Roasted Mushrooms</mark>, served cold (expected it to be hot, but i could have overlooked this on the menu) they were a very nice assortment of different types of mushrooms. also ordered the pasta fa<mark>G</mark> soup, <mark>G</mark> but more like a chicken noodle soup plus <mark>G</mark> cheese stuffed peppers, pretty presentation and <mark>G</mark>, not <mark>G</mark>.
    main courses also <mark>G</mark> presentations  on each, 2 kale ~ faro salads with <mark>G</mark> cheese, the special pasta of the day e<mark>G</mark> lasa<mark>G</mark> & <mark>Lemon Pesto <mark>G</mark> Cheese</mark> with prosciutto & pesto served with these interesting zucchini potato shreddin<mark>G</mark>, which were quite different, interesting and a very nice chan<mark>G</mark> from fries, chips or salad~
   our issues came with desserts ~ we were celebrating a b day ordered the cookie sampler, <mark>G</mark> selections, zeppoles, 2 re<mark>G</mark> coffees along with an espresso.
the cookie plate had happy b day written in chocolate, very artistically done and the cookies were <mark>G</mark>......and of course they were on the bill~.we just questioned couldn't this been a complimentary b day dessert? the price was $8.00 so not expensive, and yes they were ordered but really <mark>G</mark>???? it would have been a very nice way to complete the meal. i suspect that our server could have requested this as an option to be deleted from the bill, but for whatever reason he chose not to quite disappointing.our bill was over $200 for lunch so a<mark>G</mark> the money wasn't an issue, just seem like very poor customer service, and were locals!!
   you have a chance to rate your experience before you leave the restaurant, and we did and all the marks were excellent with a ratin<mark>G</mark>, except the host stand which we <mark>G</mark> a b. all in all it was a very nice afternoon, the restaurant is very nicely appointed and pretty with her name or initial everywhere, hey it's her restaurant so why not? will we be back? probably, however with sooo many options on the strip it could be awhile.

being a <mark>G</mark> fan of <mark>G</mark> i was so excited to hear she opened up her own restaurant here in my hometown, sin city. i found out the wait list for her restaurant is about 4 months long and saw my hopes of dining there slip away. come to find out my best friend surprised  me by making reservations months in advance for my birthday and my dreams came true. 

we had 1:45 reservations, we walk up to the hostess at about 1:20 to let her know we were in the vicinity, she made it very clear that she didn't want anything to do with us until our strict 1:45 reservation time. our time came and i went back to the desk to let her know we're ready, she had our table ready very promptly at 1:45.

the dining area at first <mark>G</mark> is beautiful, pristine white makes everything look sparkling clean. we are seated and in a few moments the waiter is over. he <mark>G</mark> over the menu in depth and <mark>G</mark> us a moment to decide. 

when he returns he answers all our questions in <mark>G</mark> detail and listened to our
specific needs (one of us doesn't eat meat). we ordered the <mark>Wood Roasted Mushrooms</mark> and chicken <mark>Orzo Meatballs</mark> to start. also ordered two muddled strawberries which is a brilliant concoction of tea,lemonade,strawberries, and basil. all
of these dishes were an absolute smash. we order our main dishes which were a frittata and <mark>G</mark>'s lasa<mark>G</mark>. both of these dishes were <mark>G</mark> and we had not a sin<mark>G</mark> complaint with them. they also bring you a sort of pita bread with a pesto oil spread which is <mark>G</mark> as well. they have a <mark>G</mark> of whose job it is to make sure your water is always full which was nice. with it being my birthday we of course ordered dessert which was a tiramisu and a cappuccino of sorts with nutella. they even wrote "happy birthday" in chocolate on my
plate. these desserts really smashed this experience throu<mark>G</mark> the roof.

as we wait for the waiter to bring the bill i see <mark>G</mark> herself talking to some patrons in the restaurant. my heart of course stops and our waiter personally asked her to come to my table because it was my birthday. she sat and took a picture with me, wished me a happy birthday, made sure our lunch was everything we expected, and said she liked my hair. i died on the inside. the food was awesome, our waiter was a class act, and the <mark>G</mark> was everything i'd hope she be. 

the reasons i <mark>G</mark> this four stars ........ the epic waiting list which reaches 4 months
is extreme but totally understandable. the portion sizes of these dishes are minimal at best and very pricey. 

everyone should definitely try this restaurant. not a place to <mark>G</mark> full but a dynamite venue for a special event. from the food to the staff to <mark>G</mark> herself an absolute smash.

we had a table with a view which i would say makes the experience just that much more memorable!  we started with the olives, the <mark>Wood Roasted Mushrooms</mark> and the orozo meatballs. all very tasty, but by far the mushrooms are a must if you enjoy mushrooms. the meatballs were <mark>G</mark>, but a little lacking in flavor which seems to be the consensus with other reviews. nothing a pinch of salt won't fix, better not enou<mark>G</mark> salt then to much!  the sauce from the meats balls in the other hand we all wanted to eat with the bread and everything else!    i orders the hannibal as a cocktail which was way to much ice not enou<mark>G</mark> hannibal, but the taste was <mark>G</mark>. not my favorite , but still tasty and <mark>G</mark> with my meal.  we had the risotto with scallops , the spa<mark>G</mark> si<mark>G</mark> dish, salmon (which believe it or not in my opinion was the best dish of the ni<mark>G</mark>)  and the 7oz filet!  for sides aspara<mark>G</mark> which was delicious , potatoes were super tasty and my all time favorite the corn!  i ended up adding the corn the the spa<mark>G</mark> which made the spa<mark>G</mark> a super delicious dish because of of all the flavor in the corn that it added to the pasta.  deserts we  all amazing and the lemoncello did not disappoint.  for sure a <mark>G</mark> place for a date or a special event as it was easy to carry conversation and the views of the stop are <mark>G</mark> .

i'm a little torn about this one folks.  i've always enjoyed watching <mark>G</mark> de laurentiis' shows on food network so i couldn't be anymore happier when the chef decided to have her first ever restaurant in las ve<mark>G</mark>.  too bad celebrity chef restaurants usually don't live up to the hype due to such hi<mark>G</mark> expectations and sadly, this one's no exception.

the restaurant itself has a nice ambiance. despite of the tables being so close to each other, details throu<mark>G</mark> made it feel as if we were dining at home so it wasn't too awkward/uncomfortable being seated less than a foot away from other <mark>G</mark>.  if i were to do it a<mark>G</mark>, i'd certainly do what phillip t. recommends on his review and request for a premium table overlooking bella<mark>G</mark> or caesar's palace no matter how long it takes.

food in <mark>G</mark> was <mark>G</mark>.  looking back, however, portions were relatively small considering of how much they're char<mark>G</mark> for each dish.  this surely isn't your rustic italian joint where you can <mark>G</mark> lar<mark>G</mark> bowls of pasta that can feed a whole town!    

upon ordering, our server brou<mark>G</mark> out a complimentary platter of breadsticks, rosemary focaccia and cheese crisps as well as several accoutrements.  several antipasti plates then followed which quickly filled our table.  few favorites include charred octopus, <mark>Wood Roasted Mushrooms</mark> and prosciutto di parma.  the parmi<mark>G</mark>-re<mark>G</mark> was also <mark>G</mark> especially when eaten with the wild-sa<mark>G</mark> honey and rosemary focaccia.  i say skip the burrata since texture was quite unpleasant instead of that smooth consistency everyone has been accustomed to.

i opted for the risotto as my main entree since i'm a sucker for creamy pearls of rice prepared w/ tasty seafood broth.  unfor<mark>Tuna</mark>, what was served was rather disappointing: rice was underdone and seasoning was lacking.  althou<mark>G</mark> the scallops were perfectly cooked, i actually would've never thou<mark>G</mark> the dish came with crabs if it weren't for the menu listing the item as one of its in<mark>G</mark>.

while my food was completely amiss, her spa<mark>G</mark>, on the other hand, was easily one of the few hi<mark>G</mark> of the ni<mark>G</mark>.  in fact, i'd pick this over your re<mark>G</mark> meatball and marinara pasta any day.  one thing that cau<mark>G</mark> my attention as soon as the dish was placed on the table was how enormous the prawns were.  the lemon and basil sauce also went really well with the pasta.  if i could eat this everyday, i absolutely would in a heartbeat!

service was <mark>G</mark> and staff knowled<mark>G</mark> of everything on the menu.  for<mark>G</mark> his name but i'm assuming our server was fairly new since he was <mark>G</mark> plenty of complaints from other <mark>G</mark>.  he even char<mark>G</mark> our card with someone else's tab; making us wait for some time and not even a dessert was <mark>G</mark> to compensate for his mistake.

i'm <mark>G</mark> on a curve here, but for a restaurant this expensive (the most expensive italian restaurant i've ever seen) i just wasn't all that impressed.  first, the <mark>G</mark>:  a diverse menu of italian dishes, meant to be enjoyed over at least three courses.  a nicely appointed room, with a <mark>G</mark> view of the strip -- caesar's palace and the bella<mark>G</mark> across the street (somewhat marred, on the ni<mark>G</mark> we dined, by the massive fatal car crash just down the street; but that's hardly <mark>G</mark>'s fault).  and, <mark>G</mark> really knows how to pack the flavor into her dishes.  my bacon wrapped dates, crab crostini, and tricolore salad all screamed their respective flavors.

but, there were some aspects i didn't care for.  first, the food is rich, rich, rich, even for italian.  even thou<mark>G</mark> i only had two appetizers and a salad, i felt bloated on the way out; and i can usually pack it away.  second, the relentless emphasis on <mark>G</mark>'s name.  our waiter only mentioned her about two or three dozen times.  the plates, menu, and even the towels in the bathroom were emblazoned with "<mark>G</mark>."  i've never seen anything like it at any other celebrity chef restaurant, and i've been to a bunch of them.  third, and i really don't know how to explain this, but the atmosphere just didn't feel comfortable to me.  the dining room is a little bit crowded and a bit of a maze to <mark>G</mark> throu<mark>G</mark>.  the menu is a sli<mark>G</mark> difficult to fi<mark>G</mark> out, and the waiter wasn't that much help (the answer to every question about the menu was a story about how <mark>G</mark> loves this or that dish).  and the presentation of every dish was, kind of "wow!  look at me!"  in short, everything was just a little bit overwhelming, and i <mark>G</mark> my mental ima<mark>G</mark> of italian food is of comfort food in a homey environment, so it just felt a little off to me.

left kind of hun<mark>G</mark> and with noticeably li<mark>G</mark> pockets. next time, i'll spend my money elsewhere. <mark>G</mark> its ve<mark>G</mark>, so what the hell *throws cash everywhere*.

i had the sunrise polenta waffle (a must try). crispy waffle, with sli<mark>G</mark> savory taste and served with house infused syrup and beschamel. my wife had the salmon e<mark>G</mark> benedict. both were filling and so flavorful. my wife also had the <mark>Dolce Vita</mark>, a <mark>G</mark> breakfast cocktail with elderflower.

they had these comfy seating, too and a <mark>G</mark> view of the bella<mark>G</mark> fountains.
